verses.name: Psalms 49:1
verses.text: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:

verses.name: Psalms 49:2
verses.text: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.

verses.name: Psalms 49:3
verses.text: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.

verses.name: Psalms 49:4
verses.text: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.

verses.name: Psalms 49:5
verses.text: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?

verses.name: Psalms 49:6
verses.text: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;

verses.name: Psalms 49:7
verses.text: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:

verses.name: Psalms 49:8
verses.text: (For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

verses.name: Psalms 49:9
verses.text: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.

verses.name: Psalms 49:10
verses.text: For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

verses.name: Psalms 49:11
verses.text: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.

verses.name: Psalms 49:12
verses.text: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.

verses.name: Psalms 49:13
verses.text: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 49:14
verses.text: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.

verses.name: Psalms 49:15
verses.text: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 49:16
verses.text: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;

verses.name: Psalms 49:17
verses.text: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

verses.name: Psalms 49:18
verses.text: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

verses.name: Psalms 49:19
verses.text: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.

verses.name: Psalms 49:20
verses.text: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.
